New Records: The West Indies total of 328 was a record ODI total at the Sir Vivian Richards Stadium.
Key Match Events: Liam Livingstone scored an unbeaten 124, leading England to victory.
Shai Hope made a superb 117 for the West Indies.
Livingstone and Sam Curran combined for a key partnership with 169 to win from 22 overs.
Livingstone blazed 22 off five deliveries in the 45th over.
Livingstone struck three consecutive sixes and a four to leave two runs required off the last three overs.
Pre-Game Insights: The captain implored his side to 'bat smarter' after England's defeat in the opening match.
Post-Match Reflections: Livingstone expressed happiness in leading from the front.
Livingstone reflected on his desire for more responsibility and belief in his abilities.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England used nine bowlers across an innings for only the second time in their history.
England's fielding performance was marked by dropped catches and sloppy mistakes.
